text:
Hi <@UE6GFQQ20> to use the utility as a provider would require a commercial agreement. I'm happy to discuss what that means and I'd be interested to learn more about your use case. I would also include someone from our Sales Team. Best regards
Frank

text: There’s another credential that may be required for the *holder service* (this is part of your *provider configuration*). While the *instrument configuration* is specific to the tokens you issue, the *provider configuration* is utility-wide and applies to everyone you onboard. We’ll most likely remove this additional requirement in the next release.

I'm working with an external party? How can I transfer the token out? The external party cannot sign in to the utility to accept the transfer offer?

I attempt to find pending transfer by querying active-contracts but It returns none.

text: Seeing the same issue today on our Utility installation.

elements.text: Seeing the same issue today on our Utility installation.

text: So what is the fastest solution available today? We want to top up a Credential, but can't access the UI.

text:
If you are getting the same 503s, then the resolution from Tony is what you can do today:

<https://daholdings.slack.com/archives/C08338ZAL9X/p1754392989809329?thread_ts=1754391976.487539&cid=C08338ZAL9X>

elements.text:
It seems to be due to Utility app not being able to efficiently query ACS properly.

Can try to following:
Prune participant node to free up space so that query load is lighter (solve the issue temporarily)
Increase IOPS on the infrastructure side of things (resolves the issue more efficiently)
It doesn’t fully address the issue
but it should still be somewhat functional (as compared to totally useable)

attachments.fallback:
[August 5th, 2025 4:23 AM] tonychew: It seems to be due to Utility app not being able to efficiently query ACS properly.

Can try to following:
• Prune participant node to free up space so that query load is lighter (solve the issue temporarily)
• Increase IOPS on the infrastructure side of things (resolves the issue more efficiently)
It doesn’t fully address the issue for us but it should still be somewhat functional (as compared to totally useable)

Can try to following:
• Prune participant node to free up space so that query load is lighter (solve the issue temporarily)
• Increase IOPS on the infrastructure side of things (resolves the issue more efficiently)
It doesn’t fully address the issue for us but it should still be somewhat functional (as compared to totally useable)

text:
[Testnet] Hi, we are trying to offer paid credentials and getting the following error.
Free credentials worked smoothly.
What can be the reason?
